intro: Allantoma pachyantha, commonly known as the broad-leaved allantoma, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, leathery pods that contain seeds. Allantoma pachyantha is adapted to dry environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and animals.
